content.description:
Fire Tower is a 35 FT granite face.  It has no fixed protection or bolts and requires you to bring your own nuts or cams to top rope. The top has very little to work with for anchoring (bare rock) so be sure to bring at least 30ft of roped to set up.  Bolting should not be done without permission from Terra Nova National Park.  For setting the anchor and top roping it is an easy walk from the base to the top around a small ridge. 



Fire Tower is on the far east side of Louil Hill.  It is easiest to walk to the top the hill from the west them down to the face on the east side. 

You will need nuts or cams to top rope Fire Tower there is no fixed protection, or trees, or rock features to tie too. Bring extra rope for top roping as well as spots to place protection are limited at the top.

Louil Hill is in Terra Nova National Park. Louil Hill is often  windy and the weather can be cold and rainy so make sure to check the weather before leaving. Most if not all the rock on Louil Hill is granite and it makes for great climbing with some fair size faces. Louil Hill stands at around 450 ft high above sea level and provides great views as well as climbing.  There are no bolts, or fixed anchors however almost all of the routes can be top roped. There are a number of boulders and boulder sized cliff faces as well.  The hill itself has a couple of nice climbable faces in the 20-50ft range, but the escarpment to the south that runs between the two hills is about 300m long and has a good number of potential routes from ~30 to 100ft.  Most of these have yet to be climbed. The final approach to the area will require about 0.5km of bush whacking.
